skill.name: content-research-writer
skill.description: Assists in writing high-quality content by conducting research, adding citations, improving hooks, iterating on outlines, and providing real-time feedback on each section. Transforms your writing process from solo effort to collaborative partnership.
skill.summary: Assists in writing high-quality content by conducting research, adding citations, improving hooks, i...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access beyond standard AI capabilities. Purely instructional content for writing assistance.

content.value_statement: Writing quality content takes significant effort. This skill transforms solo writing into a collaborative partnership by providing research assistance, structured outlines, real-time section feedback, and proper citation management.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured outlines with research placeholders and logical flow
Conducts research on topics and adds proper citations
Improves article hooks and introductions for better engagement
Provides section-by-section feedback on clarity, flow, and evidence
Preserves writer's voice and style across revisions
Manages citations and references in multiple formats
limitations: Does not write full articles from scratch without user input
Does not access paid databases or subscription-only sources
Does not verify facts beyond web search capabilities
Cannot publish or upload content to external platforms

use_cases.title: Write blog posts faster
use_cases.description: Create outlines, research key points, and get section-by-section feedback to publish quality articles efficiently.

use_cases.title: Document with citations
use_cases.description: Write technical documentation with proper research, citations, and clear explanations for complex topics.

use_cases.title: Develop compelling narratives
use_cases.description: Craft opinion pieces and thought leadership content with strong hooks, evidence, and distinctive voice.

prompt_templates.title: Create outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an outline for an article about [topic]. Ask me about my target audience, length, and writing goals first.

prompt_templates.title: Research topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Research [specific topic] and add citations to my outline. Find recent data and credible sources I can reference.

prompt_templates.title: Improve hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Here's my introduction: [paste text]. Analyze it and provide 3 alternative hooks with explanations of why each works.

prompt_templates.title: Get feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this section I just wrote: [paste section]. Give me specific feedback on clarity, flow, and suggestions for improvement.

output_examples.input: Help me create an outline for an article about remote work productivity.
output: Before I create your outline, I have a few questions:
• What's your main argument or thesis about remote work productivity?
• Who is your target audience? (managers, individual contributors, founders)
• What's your target length? (short blog post, long-form article, guide)
• What's your preferred writing style? (formal, conversational, data-driven)
• Do you have existing research or personal experience to include?

best_practices: Work on one section at a time and get feedback before moving on to maintain momentum.
Save research separately in a research.md file to keep your draft focused and clean.
Specify your voice and style preferences early so the skill can match your tone throughout.
anti_patterns: Don't expect the skill to write your entire article without your input on each section.
Avoid skipping the outlining phase - it saves time and improves structure later.
Don't ignore feedback on citations - unverifiable claims weaken your credibility.

faq.question: What AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for writing assistance.

faq.question: Can it access paid research databases?
faq.answer: No. The skill searches publicly available web sources. For subscription-only research, provide your own sources.

faq.question: How does it handle citations?
faq.answer: It supports inline citations, numbered references, and footnotes. It maintains a running reference list for your article.

faq.question: Is my writing data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no data storage. Your content stays within your Claude session.

faq.question: Why is my outline not being generated?
faq.answer: The skill asks clarifying questions first. Answer them to get a tailored outline for your specific needs.

faq.question: How is this different from a basic writing assistant?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured workflows, research integration, section-by-section iterative feedback, and voice preservation across revisions.
